LIMITATIONS ON DISCLOSURE AND USE IN CIVIL PROCEEDINGS. (a) Disclosures to Law Enforcement and Government Agencies: The Attorney General must provide covered firearms information to law enforcement agencies, federal agencies, Members of Congress, or government executives for law enforcement, national security, or intelligence purposes. (b) Protections Against Public Disclosure: No government entity can disclose covered firearms information that identifies undercover officers or informants, contains case-specific details, or includes identifying information of firearm purchasers. (c) Limitations on Use in Civil Proceedings. (c) Limitations on Use in Civil Proceedings. Covered firearms information may be used in court or administrative proceedings, except for information from the Firearms Trace System database, which cannot be used in qualified civil liability actions. Covered firearms information can be used in governmental administrative proceedings initiated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives or government agencies for enforcement or licensing purposes. This information cannot be used in qualified civil liability actions or if it identifies undercover law enforcement officers or confidential informants. The curr_chunk states that a review of an action or proceeding described in the previous paragraphs can be conducted.
